content: this pattern was originally designed for a month-long mcal so it is written out in 5 separate parts the scarf is crocheted in 3 separate pieces that are seamed together it is a keyhole scarf so no need to tie a knot when wearing the colorwork features a snowman on one end and a snowflake on the other with the yarn being held within the work so there is neither a wrong or a right side you can be as crazy or as reserved as you would like with the color combinations my example is a bit on the wild side which i prefer i used 4 different yarns but you could easily use just 3 different yarns you could also use scraps and thus any number of yarns as it is a scarf gauge is not really that important and i did not pay attention to any particular gauge when creating it note that i do crochet loosely though so you may want to go up a hook size if you crochet on the tighter side to ensure decent drape for laying around your neck please reach out here on ravelry if you have any questions about the pattern blush snowflake
